content.description: Make a hard gaston move with your right hand and a difficult cross and you're home free. Continue via the rail around the corner of the boulder and mantle.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter or two
content.location: Sit start on a sloping rail on the bottom left side of the boulder (down river side).

content.description: Once you're through the tough gaston and cross sequence from the bottom, finish on Cartheuselum Right and mantle via a small crimp. Pretty committing finish.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter or two
content.location: Same start as Shoryuken. Sit start on small rail on the bottom left side of the boulder.

content.description: Cool short problem.This would be a classic easy mantle block if it had a better landing. The most precarious position is over the worst landing for the boulder. Hardest part is committing and not thinking about the landing.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter or two
content.location: Find the obvious sloping rail on the down river side of the boulder. Stand start and head straight up and mantle using a small crimp.

content.description: The Cartheuselum boulder is right on the river directly beneath the rope climbing area on the Potholes Trail. It is often the hangout spot for those waiting to get on rope climbs so you might have to fend off the crowd on the weekends. This area receives shade in the morning and sun in the afternoon. The landing is barely enough to access the boulder and during times of high water, is quite heady.
